definition: to pay respects/to wish good health/in Qing times, a specific form of salutation (see also 打千[da3 qian1])
to ask/to invite/please (do sth)/to treat (to a meal etc)/to request
surname An
content/calm/still/quiet/safe/secure/in good health/to find a place for/to install/to fix/to fit/to bring (a charge against sb)/to pacify/to harbor (good intentions)/security/safety/peace/ampere

sentences.english: On the second day in early morning, three madams accompany square the madam come to give too madam to send greeting.
sentences.chinese: 第二天一大早，三夫人陪着方夫人来给太夫人请安。

sentences.english: Father, Theodule is coming to present his respects to you this morning.
sentences.chinese: 我的父亲，今天早晨忒阿杜勒要来向您请安。

sentences.english: Please arrange for shipment by nest available steamer.
sentences.chinese: 请安排队下一班可订到舱位的轮船装运。

sentences.english: Greet them in the morning to show them that you care.
sentences.chinese: 早上要跟父母请安表示你的关心。

sentences.english: Children, recess is over, so simmer down and take your seats, please.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们，休息时间已过并请安静坐回原处。

sentences.english: BaoYi whoever took Andy to have a meal, please noted please her neighbors.
sentences.chinese: 包奕凡趁机请安迪吃饭，特别提到一并请她的邻居们。

sentences.english: Please give my best regards to him.
Gentlemen say hello first to ladies.

definition: to pay one's respects/to give regards to
to pay a formal visit/to call to pay respects/to meet one's senior or superior
to salute/to make one's salutations
to kowtow in salute
congratulate an elderly person on his birthday/offer birthday felicitations
morning and evening visits to parents/cf 昏定晨省[hun1 ding4 chen2 xing3]
to have an audience (with the emperor)
to salute/to greet
to apologize humbly/to beg forgiveness
to congratulate
to dine
to kowtow (traditional greeting, esp. to a superior, involving kneeling and pressing one's forehead to the ground)
(formal) you may dispense with curtseying
to thank sb for favor (esp. emperor or superior official)
(old) to stand up (after kowtowing)/You may rise.
to have an audience (with the Emperor)
